deposit(bytes32,bytes32,bool).details: First txn in the flip process, ('userRandom') is a random bytes32 generated by the frontend, and ('userCommitment') is the hashed version. These parameters are used to obtain the sequence number from Entropy, and request a random number to determine the outcome of the coin flip.

flip(uint64,bytes32).details: Second txn in the flip process, throws if caller is not the account linked to ('sequenceNumber'). This function completes the Entropy process, revealing the random number and settling the coin flip.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

documentation.text:
@dev Records and stores user and global statistics after a successful flip. Heads/tails
 choice count, win/loss count, last ten flips, and current streak are all recorded.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "accounts must flip after a deposit"

arguments.value: accounts must flip after a deposit

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "accounts must flip after a deposit"

documentation.text:
@dev Second txn in the flip process, throws if caller is not the account linked to ('sequenceNumber').
 This function completes the Entropy process, revealing the random number and settling the coin flip.
